result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery Kevin Gleason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffery Kevin Gleason is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffery Kevin Gleason was found guilty of Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).
  • Jeffery Kevin Gleason was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Jeffery Kevin Gleason was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: T. Gregory Amann DF: Jeffery Kevin Gleason appeared from jail. Case called at 11:02. Includes 15CF432, 16CF199, 16CF227. ADA Minser updates the court and requests that the police report be read in for purposes of restitution for the vehicle. Atty. Amann agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1,3 and 9 in the amended information in 15CF432. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 16CF227. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, 3, 9 in amended information in 15CF432 and guilty of Ct 1 in 16CF227. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 in 15CF432, Ct 2 in 16CF227 and outright dismisses 16CF199. Court finds any restitution will be joint and several with Alex Kranz. Court orders a PSI.

Arraignment at 09-29-2015 03:45 pm

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, David, Tammy M. or their property.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-No possession of firearms 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
